fr.sii.ogham.core.builder

Class MessagingBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.MessagingBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<MessagingService>, MessagingServiceBuilder

    public class MessagingBuilder
extends Object
implements MessagingServiceBuilder
    Basic implementation of the builder that help to construct the messaging service. It relies on the specialized builders for:
    • EmailBuilder for helping to construct email sender
    • SmsBuilder for helping construct sms sender
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • MessagingBuilder

        public MessagingBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public MessagingService build()
                       throws BuildException
        Build the messaging service. The messaging service relies on the generated senders. Each sender is able to manage one or multiple messages. The default implementation of the messaging service is to ask each sender if it is able to handle the message and if it the case, then use this sender to really send the message. This implementation doesn't stop when the message is handled by a sender to possibly let another send the message through another channel.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<MessagingService>
        Returns:
        the messaging service instance
        Throws:
        BuildException - when one of the sender couldn't be built

      • useAllDefaults

        public MessagingBuilder useAllDefaults()
        Tells the builder to use all default behavior and values. The configuration values will be read from the system properties. The builder will construct the messaging service with the following senders:
        • An email sender that is able to construct email content with or without template
        • A SMS sender that is able to construct email content with or without template
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use
        See Also:
        More information about created email sender, More information about created SMS sender

      • useAllDefaults

        public MessagingBuilder useAllDefaults(Properties properties)
        Tells the builder to use all default behavior and values. The configuration values will be read from the provided properties. The builder will construct the messaging service with the following senders:
        • An email sender that is able to construct email content with or without template
        • A SMS sender that is able to construct email content with or without template
        Parameters:
        properties - indicate which properties to use instead of using the system ones
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use
        See Also:
        More information about created email sender, More information about created SMS sender

      • useEmailDefaults

        public MessagingBuilder useEmailDefaults()
        Tells the builder to use default behaviors and values for email sender. The configuration values will be read from the provided properties. This method is automatically called when using useAllDefaults(Properties).
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use
        See Also:
        More information about created email sender

      • useEmailDefaults

        public MessagingBuilder useEmailDefaults(Properties properties)
        Tells the builder to use the default behaviors and values for email sender. The configuration values will be read from the provided properties. This method is automatically called when using useAllDefaults(Properties).
        Parameters:
        properties - indicate which properties to use instead of using the system ones
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use
        See Also:
        More information about created email sender

      • withEmail

        public MessagingBuilder withEmail()
        Tells the builder to activate the email sender. This method is automatically called when using useAllDefaults(), useAllDefaults(Properties), useEmailDefaults() or useEmailDefaults(Properties).
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • withSms

        public MessagingBuilder withSms()
        Tells the builder to activate the sms sender. This method is automatically called when using useAllDefaults(), useAllDefaults(Properties), useEmailDefaults() or useEmailDefaults(Properties).
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • getSmsBuilder

        public SmsBuilder getSmsBuilder()
        Get access to the SMS specialized builder. The aim is to be able to fine tune the SMS sender.
        Returns:
        The specialized builder for SMS sender.

      • getEmailBuilder

        public EmailBuilder getEmailBuilder()
        Get access to the email specialized builder. The aim is to be able to fine tune the email sender.
        Returns:
        The specialized builder for email sender.
